thread.title: Oops...Abbott's office tweets congrats on victory to losing team
thread.title_full: Oops...Abbott's office tweets congrats on victory to losing team

title: Oops...Abbott's office tweets congrats on victory to losing team
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Oops...Abbott's office tweets congrats on victory to losing team Governor Greg Abbott may have drawn a balk for his false start on a tweet about the Houston Astros Monday afternoon. Post to Facebook Oops...Abbott's office tweets congrats on victory to losing team Governor Greg Abbott may have drawn a balk for his false start on a tweet about the Houston Astros Monday afternoon.  //kvue.tv/1RDd1ZY   Oops...Abbott's office tweets congrats on victory to losing team KVUE 4:35 p.m. CDT October 12, 2015 Oct 12, 2015; Houston, TX, USA; Kansas City Royals relief pitcher Ryan Madson (46) reacts after Houston Astros shortstop Carlos Correa (1) hits a two-run home run during the seventh inning in game four of the ALDS at Minute Maid Park. Mandatory Credit: Thomas B. Shea-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Thomas Shea, Thomas B. Shea-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HOUSTON -- Governor Greg Abbott may have drawn a balk for his false start on a tweet about the Houston Astros Monday afternoon. 
Governor Abbott, or someone in his office, tweeted congratulations to the Houston Astros when the team had a 6-2 lead heading into the eighth inning. It may have seemed logical considering Houston was just six outs away from a trip to the American League Championship Series. 
Tweeet sent by Greg Abbott Congratulating Astros on victory. (Photo: Twitter) 
There was just that little thing of closing out the final two innings of the game. Houston took the lead into the eighth inning and proceeded to blow the lead en route to a 9-6 loss to the Royals. 
This is where the term oops might come in handy. 
After the Royals rallied in the eighth, the tweet, which came from the account @GovAbbott , was quickly deleted. The @GovAbott handle is for "official news form the Office of Texas Governor Greg Abbott and is verified by Twitter. Read or Share this story: http://kvue.tv/1RDd1ZY TOP VIDEOS
